item.title: Wildgate is a new space based team shooter coming to PC, PS5, and Xbox Series XS
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/25/wildgate-is-a-new-space-based-team-shooter-coming-to-pc-ps5-and-xbox-series-xs/

Moonshot Games has announced a brand new team based shooter set in space, and it is called Wildgate. Wildgate will mix up space combat, looting, ship boarding, and a whole lot of first person shooting. If that sounds like something right up your street, you won’t have to wait long as there is going to be a  Wildgate community playtest from April 10th to April 14th which will be on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series XS.

In Wildgate, five teams of four known as Prospectors travel through hostile regions of space, which are randomised each time. to search for a treasure known as the Artifact. Finding the Artifact and escaping with it is one way to win the match. The other is to dominate by destroying the rival team ships however you can. That includes facing off in ship to ship combat or boarding enemy ships to sabotage them from within.

Going back to the community playtest, Moonshot Studios has stated that the full game will be available to play, but signing up for the playtest does not guarantee that you will get a key for it. It has also been confirmed that cross play between the three platforms will be available, and at release there will be cross progression too. The game will also feature audio and text in the following languages; English, French, German, Italian, Castilian Spanish, Latin American Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese, Korean, Japanese, and Simplified Chinese. There will also be traditional Chinese text.

If you are playing on PC the specs needed as follows:

Minimum Specification:

Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
Windows 11
Processor: Intel Core i7-8700K or AMD Ryzen 5 5600X
Graphics: GeForce GTX 1070 Ti [8 GB] or Radeon RX 5700 XT [8 GB] Memory: 16 GB
Direct X: Version 12
Storage: SSD, 50 GB
Network: Broadband Internet Connection

Recommended system requirements:

Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
Windows 11
Processor: Intel i7-9700K / AMD Ryzen 7 3700X
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070 or AMD Radeon RX 5700 XT
Memory: 16GB RAM
Storage: 50GB available
Direct X: Version 12
Network: Broadband Internet Connection

All the progress made in the Wildgate playtest will not carry over to the full release.

Source: Welcome to Wildgate

item.title: War Rats: The Rat em Up launches into Early Access on April 22nd
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/25/war-rats-the-rat-em-up-launches-into-early-access-on-april-22nd/

Solo dev Wootus of Wootusart Industries has announced that the 2D shooter and strategy title War Rats: The Rat em Up will be available in Steam Early Access from April 22nd. In War Rats, you are a Rat commander that has to lead troops into a battle against the forces of TechnoRat. In this world rats are the only inhabitants.

“As a solo dev, I would love to involve the players in shaping the game, especially when it comes to balancing. This kind of game can be very challenging for some players while for others it will be a breeze. I feel like Early Access would be a great place to get that balance right. I would also like people to be able to play the Singleplayer portion of the game without having to wait for Multiplayer to be finished”,said Wootus.

War Rats battles are a mix of 2D action where you go and fight the enemy troops, and a base building as you command troops to construct things like turrets. You can also recruit more rat troops to face off against the enemy forces, as going alone will lead to absolute failure. The early access release will contain the full single player campaign as well as a skirmish mode that allows players to choose which map to fight in. The full release of War Rats, which is estimated to come out six months after the early access release, will contain co-op and PvP multiplayer. The additional modes include Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, and Conquest. There will also be more single player content including horde mode.

Source: Press Release
